services.name: AI Music Tutor
services.overview: The AI Music Tutor is a personalized learning platform that delivers real-time feedback on a student's musical performance. Utilizing advanced audio analysis and machine learning, the tutor analyzes the student's playing through microphone input, comparing it to the ideal performance of the selected piece. This includes assessments of pitch accuracy, rhythmic precision, tempo consistency, and expressive nuances. The system adapts to the student's skill level and personal musical goals, offering customized exercises and guidance. This AI tutor aims to bridge the gap between traditional music lessons and independent practice, providing immediate, actionable feedback to accelerate learning and enhance student engagement.
problems_addressed: Lack of personalized attention and immediate feedback during practice sessions.
Difficulty in identifying and correcting subtle errors in pitch, rhythm, and tempo.
Frustration and reduced motivation due to slow progress and lack of individualized guidance.
target_users: Music students of all levels (beginner to advanced) learning any instrument.
Music teachers seeking to supplement their instruction and provide students with personalized practice tools.
core_features: **Real-time Performance Analysis:** Analyzes pitch, rhythm, tempo, and expression in real-time via microphone input, providing immediate feedback on accuracy and consistency.

**Personalized Feedback and Exercises:** Tailors feedback and practice exercises based on the student's skill level, identified weaknesses, and musical goals. This includes suggesting specific sections to repeat, alternative fingerings, or exercises to improve technique.

**Progress Tracking and Reporting:** Tracks student progress over time, providing detailed reports on their strengths and weaknesses. Teachers can access this data to gain insights into student performance and adjust lesson plans accordingly.

**Interactive Sheet Music Display:** Displays interactive sheet music that follows the student's performance, highlighting sections being played and providing visual cues for correct notes and rhythms.

**Instrument and Genre Customization:** Supports a wide range of instruments (piano, guitar, violin, voice, etc.) and musical genres (classical, jazz, pop, etc.), allowing students to focus on their specific interests.
user_journeys: **New User Onboarding:** User signs up, selects their instrument and skill level, sets their musical goals (e.g., learn a specific piece, improve sight-reading). The system calibrates audio input and performs an initial assessment.

**Practice Session:** User selects a piece of music. The system displays interactive sheet music. As the user plays, the system analyzes their performance in real-time and provides visual and audio feedback (e.g., highlighting incorrect notes, suggesting tempo adjustments).

**Feedback Review:** After a practice session, the user reviews detailed feedback on their performance, including metrics for pitch accuracy, rhythm consistency, and tempo stability. The system suggests specific exercises to address identified weaknesses.

**Teacher Access:** Music teacher logs in and views aggregated student performance data, identifying areas where individual students or the entire class need additional support. Teachers can assign specific exercises and monitor student progress remotely.
ai_capabilities: **Audio Analysis:** Employs a custom-trained model built using Librosa for feature extraction (pitch, rhythm, tempo, timbre). This model analyzes incoming audio to identify the notes being played, their timing, and their expressive characteristics.

**Performance Comparison:** Uses dynamic time warping (DTW) to compare the student's performance to a reference performance of the same piece. DTW allows for slight variations in tempo and timing, providing a more accurate assessment of pitch and rhythm accuracy.

**Personalized Exercise Generation:** Leverages a generative model (Transformer-based) fine-tuned on a large dataset of musical exercises to create customized practice exercises based on the student's identified weaknesses. For example, if the student struggles with rhythm, the system generates exercises focused on rhythmic accuracy.

**Model Selection Notes:** Initial models can be built with open-source tools. Fine-tuning on instrument-specific datasets will be necessary for optimal performance. Consider using OpenAI for exercise generation via prompting, with careful prompt engineering to ensure musicality.

input_data_types: Audio recordings of student performances (WAV, MP3).
Student profile data (instrument, skill level, musical goals).
Teacher profile data (teaching experience, preferred teaching methods).
data_schema_recommendations: **Students Table:** student_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), first_name (VARCHAR), last_name (VARCHAR), instrument (VARCHAR), skill_level (VARCHAR), musical_goals (TEXT).
**Pieces Table:** piece_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), title (VARCHAR), composer (VARCHAR), genre (VARCHAR), difficulty (VARCHAR), sheet_music_url (VARCHAR).

**Performances Table:** performance_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), student_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), piece_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), recording_url (VARCHAR), pitch_accuracy (FLOAT), rhythm_consistency (FLOAT), tempo_stability (FLOAT), date (DATE).
**Exercises Table:** exercise_id (INT, PRIMARY KEY), piece_id (INT, FOREIGN KEY), type (VARCHAR), description (TEXT), difficulty (VARCHAR).
data_sources: Publicly available sheet music databases (e.g., MuseScore).
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: COPPA compliance for student data. GDPR compliance if operating in Europe. Ensure secure storage of audio recordings and student performance data.

required_integrations: Payment gateways (Stripe, PayPal) for subscription management.
Email providers (SendGrid, Mailchimp) for user communication and notifications.
Analytics tools (Google Analytics, Mixpanel) for tracking user engagement and platform performance.
Possible integration with existing Learning Management Systems (LMS) used by music schools.
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: Clerk or Auth0 recommended for secure user authentication and authorization. Consider SSO integration for educational institutions.

technical_specifications.architecture: The system will use a microservices architecture, with separate services for audio analysis, performance comparison, exercise generation, user management, and data storage. The frontend will be a web application built with React and Next.js, communicating with the backend via REST APIs.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions, Tone.js for audio playback and manipulation.
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions, Express.js for API routing.
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes as defined in data_requirements.
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing audio recordings and sheet music files.
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API for exercise generation. Pre-trained models for audio analysis and performance comparison (e.g., Librosa-based models).
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST APIs for communication between frontend and backend services.
recommended_tech_stack.CI_CD: GitHub â†’ Vercel automatic deploy pipeline.

API_design: **POST /api/analyze_performance:** Analyzes a student's audio recording and returns feedback on pitch accuracy, rhythm consistency, and tempo stability. Payload: { student_id: INT, piece_id: INT, recording_url: STRING } Response: { pitch_accuracy: FLOAT, rhythm_consistency: FLOAT, tempo_stability: FLOAT, feedback: STRING }.
**GET /api/exercises:** Returns a list of recommended exercises for a student. Payload: { student_id: INT } Response: [ { exercise_id: INT, description: STRING, piece_id: INT } ].
**GET /api/pieces:** Returns a list of available pieces of music. Payload: None. Response: [ { piece_id: INT, title: STRING, composer: STRING } ].
frontend_components: Interactive sheet music display component with real-time highlighting.
Audio recording component with microphone input and playback controls.
Feedback display component with visual and textual feedback on performance.
Progress tracking component with charts and graphs showing student progress over time.

deployment_instructions: **Directory Structure:** /frontend (Next.js app), /backend (Node.js server actions), /database (SQL schema), /models (pre-trained AI models).
**Environment Variables:** OPENAI_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, STRIPE_API_KEY.
**Vercel Deployment:** Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables. Enable automatic deployments on push.
**Build Outputs and Runtime Settings:** Configure Next.js build output directory. Set Node.js runtime version.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Basic (limited features, free), Premium (full features, monthly/annual subscription), Enterprise (custom pricing, dedicated support).
Usage-based pricing: Charge per practice session or per exercise generated.
Add-ons: Offer premium content libraries, personalized coaching sessions with human teachers.

success_metrics: **Operational KPIs:** Number of active users, subscription revenue, customer acquisition cost, customer churn rate.
**AI Performance KPIs:** Pitch accuracy improvement rate, rhythm consistency improvement rate, correlation between AI feedback and teacher feedback.
**Adoption/Engagement KPIs:** Number of practice sessions per user, time spent on the platform, completion rate of exercises, user satisfaction (measured through surveys).
